lines.gurmukhi: jYsy tUty nwgbyl sY ibdys jwiq; slil sMjog icrMkwl jugvq hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as betel leaves plucked from the creeper are sent to distant places and if kept in damp cloth remains useful for long,

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ pwn dy byl v`l nwloˆ tu`ty p`qy ibdys idsOrIˆ jw ky BI pwxI, dy srbMD kr ky pwxI bwr bwr ivCVkIˆdy rihx kr ky bhuq kwl qk 'jugvq hY' sMBwly rih skdy hn[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kUMj bcrw iqAwg idsMqir jwiq; ismrn iciq inribGn rhq hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as a crane deposits her young ones and fly out to distant land but always remember them in her mind as a result of which they remain alive and grow,

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ b`icAwˆ nUM iqAwg ky dUr dySwˆ nUM clI jwieAw krdI hY pr auh icq AMdr icqwrdy rihx nwl inrivGn irhw krdy (Bwv pldy rihMdy qy mrdy nhIˆ) hn[

lines.gurmukhi: gMgoidk jYsy Bir BwNjn lY jwiq jwqRI; sujsu ADwr inrml inbhq hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as travellers carry water of river Ganges in their container, and being of superior disposition it stays good for long,

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ jwqRI lok brqn Br Br ky gMgoidk gMgw jl lY jwieAw krdy hn Aqy auh ies sukIrqI dy Awsry ik gMgw jl ivc jwlw kdI nhIˆ pYˆdw jÎoˆ kw qÎoˆ inrml sÍ`C hI inB jwieAw krdw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur crn srin AMqir isK; sbdu sMgiq gur iDAwn kY jIAq hY [515[

Unknown.translation: Similarly if a Sikh of the True Guru somehow get separated from his Guru, he remains invigorated by virtue of holy congregation, meditation on His name and contemplating and focusing his mind in the holy feet of his True Guru.  (515)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iqsI pRkwr hI siqgurwˆ dy crxwˆ dI Srx ivc is`K nUM AMqir AMqrw iv`Q pY igAwˆ Bwv siqgurwˆ qoˆ iksy kwrx dUr cly jwx kwrx, auh Sbd dI sMgq ivc rihMdw hoXw Sbd AiBAws ivc ju`tw hI gurU DÎwn krdw jIaUˆxw ibqwXw krdw hY ]515]
